title: Can anyone help id this font? Woodburn and Wedge Counsel
content:
I need to match this font for a letterhead. The last they printed it was several years ago and they don't know the name of the font. They thought Serlio but the W is all wrong for that.   
   
Thanks for your help.   
Jennie ![Woodburn Font Specimen](http://web.archive.org/web/20120126173144im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/38154.jpg)
author: anonymous

comments.content: You could also have a look at [Light Classic](http://web.archive.org/web/20120126173144/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/light-classic-roman/light-classic-roman/testdrive.html?s=WOODBURN%2BAND%2BWEDGE&p=48). Not a perfect match but comes close.

This looks very much like Schneidler, but some key   
character shapes are wrong.

Thanks for your help.   
I think I can fuss with the Schneidler enough to get a match. Or maybe I'll just keep looking.   
   
Anyway, thanks again!
It has lots in common with [Weiss](http://web.archive.org/web/20120126173144/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ftbauer/weiss/familytree.html) as well. Not a match, though.
